biography.value:
This enormous pig is as large as an ox, and its mouth bristles with mismatched tusks. Its body is a lopsided mass of tumorous flesh that gives way to eyes and vestigial mouths, while long tentacles trail from its sides.

From time to time, a breach forms in the fabric of the multiverse, and the Material Plane is bathed in the energy of alien dimensions. Living creatures exposed to this incursion can undergo horrible mutations, turning into monstrous mockeries of their former shapes. One example of this phenomenon is the rift swine: once-ordinary pigs transformed into slavering horrors after being bathed in eldritch light.

Destructive Herds.

Rift swine travel in small herds. Their effect on an area can be catastrophicâ€”they eat nearly anything, possess a fiendish cunning, and delight in the destruction they cause. A rift swine has difficulty perceiving anything smaller than itself as a threat, leading it to attack most other creatures on sight and fighting until it is destroyed.

Abyssal Meat.

Rumors of vast herds of hundreds of rift swine on strongly chaos-aligned planes, cultivated by the lords of those places as a food source, are thankfully unconfirmed.

description.value: The rift swine makes one Tusk attack and two Tentacle attacks, or it makes three Warping Bolt attacks.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+7]]{+7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 ([[/damage 2d8 + 4 type=slashing]]) damage.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+7]]{+7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 ([[/damage 2d6 + 4 type=bludgeoning]]) damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[condition=grappled] (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[condition=restrained]. The rift swine has two tentacles, each of which can grapple only one target.

Ranged Spell Attack: [[/r 1d20+4]]{+4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 ([[/damage 3d6 + 1 type=force]]) damage, and the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=14]] saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls as reality-warping energies temporarily distort its body.

At the start of each of its turns, the rift swine's body experiences a mutation. Choose an option or roll a [[/r d6]] to determine the type of mutation. The mutation lasts until the start of the rift swine's next turn.
The next creature that hits the rift swine with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the rift swine takes 3 ([[/damage 1d6 type=acid]]) damage.
The next melee attack the rift swine makes that hits a creature deals an extra 3 ([[/damage 1d6 type=acid]]) damage to the creature.
The rift swine has advantage on the next attack roll it makes.
The rift swine's speed increases by 10 feet, and the rift swine doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.
The rift swine gains 10 [[/r 3d6]] temporary hp.
The rift swine has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (the rift swine's choice).

The rift swine has advantage on Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Perception]) checks that rely on sight and on saving throws against being &Reference[condition=blinded]. In addition, if the rift swine isn't &Reference[condition=blinded], creatures attacking it can't benefit from traits and features that rely on a creature's allies distracting or surrounding the rift swine, such as the Pack Tactics trait or Sneak Attack class feature.
